alert.note: Alert for Logan; Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 5:05PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mingo and southwestern Logan Counties through 530 PM EST... At 504 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Justell, or 8 miles northwest of Pikeville, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Williamson, Logan, Man, Delbarton, Chief Logan State, Holden, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Red Jacket, Chattaroy, Mallory, Matewan, West Logan, Mitchell Heights, Mount Gay, Verdunville, Chauncey, Myrtle, Switzer, Pie and Bruno. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
